Type.Name: Menu

TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Menu extends Gtk.MenuShell

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the Gtk# Thread Programming for details.

Docs.summary: A is a that implements a drop down menu.

remarks.para: A is a that implements a drop down menu consisting of a list of objects which can be navigated and activated by the user to perform application functions.
It is commonly dropped down by activating a in a or in another , it can also be popped up by activating a . Other composite widgets such as the can pop up a as well.

Docs.summary: Internal constructor

remarks.para: This is an internal constructor, and should not be used by user code.

Docs.summary: Sets or obtains the which holds global accelerators for the menu.

remarks.para: This accelerator group needs to also be added to all windows that this menu is being used in with , in order for those windows to support all the accelerators contained in this group.

Docs.summary: Sets an accelerator path for this menu from which accelerator paths for its immediate children, its menu items, can be constructed.

remarks.para: The main purpose of this function is to spare the programmer the inconvenience of having to call on each menu item that should support runtime user changable accelerators. Instead, by just calling on their parent, each menu item of this menu, that contains a label describing its purpose, automatically gets an accel path assigned.

Docs.summary: Returns the selected menu item from the menu.
Docs.value: The that was last selected in the menu. If a selection has not yet been made, the first menu item is selected.

Docs.summary: Adds a new to a (table) menu.

remarks.para: The number of 'cells' that an item will occupy is specified by , , and . These each represent the leftmost, rightmost, uppermost and lower column and row numbers of the table. (Columns and rows are indexed from zero).
Note that this function is not related to .

MemberSignature.Value: public void Popup (Gtk.Widget parent_menu_shell, Gtk.Widget parent_menu_item, Gtk.MenuPositionFunc func, uint button, uint activate_time);

.method public hidebysig instance void Popup(class Gtk.Widget parent_menu_shell, class Gtk.Widget parent_menu_item, class Gtk.MenuPositionFunc func, unsigned int32 button, unsigned int32 activate_time) cil managed

Docs.param: The menu shell containing the triggering menu item, or .
The menu item whose activation triggered the popup, or .
A user supplied function used to position the menu, or .
The mouse button which was pressed to initiate the event.
The time at which the activation event occurred.
Docs.summary: Displays a menu and makes it available for selection.

remarks.para: Applications can use this function to display context-sensitive menus, and will typically supply for the , , and parameters. The default menu positioning function will position the menu at the current mouse cursor position.

The parameter should be the mouse button pressed to initiate the menu popup. If the menu popup was initiated by something other than a mouse button press, such as a mouse button release or a keypress, button should be zero(0).
The parameter should be the time stamp of the event that initiated the popup. If such an event is not available, use instead.

Docs.summary: Selects the specified menu item within the menu.

remarks.para: This is used by the and should not be used by anyone else.

Docs.summary: Sets or obtains the tearoff state of the menu.
Docs.value: Returns if the menu is currently torn off.

remarks.para: A menu is normally displayed as drop down menu which persists as long as the menu is active. It can also be displayed as a tearoff menu which persists until it is closed or reattached.

Docs.summary: The title of this menu when it is torn off
Sets or obtains the title for the menu.
Docs.value: The title of the menu, or if the menu has no title set on it. This string is owned by the widget and should not be modified or freed.

remarks.para: The title is displayed when the menu is shown as a tearoff menu.
